titlestmt.titleproper: American Chemical Society miscellaneous printed materials and films 1891-1988 1940s-1980s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Chemical Society miscellaneous printed materials and films

bioghist.p: The American Chemical Society (ACS), founded in 1876, is a self-governed individual membership organization that consists of more than 158,000 members at all degree levels and in all fields of chemistry. The organization provides its members with opportunities for peer interaction and career development.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of miscellaneous materials relating to the American Chemical Society. Records include: programs for annual meetings (1911-1966); abstracts and papers presented at national meetings; member directories; reprints (1891-1962); and annual reports (1960-1978). The collection also includes correspondence between the Center for the History of Chemistry (which became the Chemical Heritage Foundation) and various ACS divisions; and printed material from national, regional, and divisional offices of the ACS.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
